question.title: Cannot reference module from JAR in VSC
question.body:
Trying to make it as clear as possible I created(compiled?) a jar file in java. it contains a package(folder) animal and inside the package is a Dog class. the jar file also consists of a module-info.java file named "something". the module-info.java file is outside of the animal folder not inside!

Note: I'm using vs code

the jar file structure

customPackage.jar :
--module-info.class
-- animal(folder)
 -- Dog.class

how the module-info.class looks(source)

module something {
   exports animal;
}

I compiled this project into jar with this button in vs code. which is the referenced library option where you can add jar files by the java language server extension in vs code

then I made another project in java. it also consists of a module-info.java file. the project only has a folder named source and inside consists a main.java with nothing but a normal hello world java file

I referenced the customPackage.jar file using this

]

the project structure:

javaConsole folder:

--module-info.java
--source(folder)
 -- Main.java

the module-info.java code:

 module app {
     requires something;
     exports source
   }

the "something" appears as a module in auto complete

but when I type it out, it shows an error something cannot be resolved to a module

When I run the project it says this

Error occurred during initialization of boot layer
java.lang.module.FindException: Module app not found

steps to reproduce the error. use vs code or any other ide make a java project and create a module named something and add a package named animal which consists a class or anything the module should export animal and then export it into jar and then create another java project. in referenced libraries(vs code) add the jar file . and then create a module named app in app write

module app {
  requires something;
}

I can't find much info on how to import modules into java project so had to ask it in stack overflow.

the content of the settings.json file is

{
  "java.project.referencedLibraries": [
    "lib/**/*.jar",
    "c:\\Users\\tutun\\OneDrive\\Documents\\customPackage\\customPackage.jar"
  ]
}

I tried to make sure the jar file was in the referenced libraries properly. did a lot of google search
